Instruction.Message:
In this experiment, you are going to see black boxes floating in front of you. For brief durations on the order of a fraction of a second, these boxes will display letters. You are asked to report the letters after each trial by typing them in.
You are asked to report only <color=red>red</color> letters and ignore <color=blue>blue</color> letters if any.
Press A when you are ready to continue

To become familiar with the procedure, you are now going to perform a few practice trials. At the beginning of each trial, fixate on the cross in the center of the screen and try to memorize the letters that will appear briefly afterwards.
You will notice that the trials differ in difficulty. Display durations are always short but some are even shorter than others. In this practice block, you will receive individual feedback after each trial. You will not receive such feedback in the following blocks.
Press A when you are ready to start the first trial

PartialReport.ReportQueryTop: Which letters do you recall? Only report letters for which you are certain and refrain from guessing!
PartialReport.ReportQueryBottom: Please enter the letters and press A to continue to the next trial

TrialFeedback.MessageBottom: Press A when you are ready to continue

Instruction.Message:
You are now starting trial block 1 of 9.
Remember to fixate on the cross at the beginning of each trial and that you are asked to report only <color=red>red</color> letters and ignore <color=blue>blue</color> letters if any. You will not receive feedback after each trial but you will see your score for this block in % correct after the last trial. Please try to achieve approx. 80-90% correct!
Press A when you are ready to start the first trial
